body_content.explanation: a Christian priest with special duties in a cathedral
a rule, principle, or law, especially in the Christian Church
the writings or other works that are generally agreed to be good, important, and worth studying:
examples: He has made it into the canon of English poetry.
She argues that the canon must be opened up to more non-European writers.
People sometimes think the classical music canon finishes around 1900.

body_content.explanation: all the writings or other works known to be by a particular person:
examples: This is as important a piece of music as any in the Mahler canon.

body_content.explanation: a book, TV show, film, etc. that its fans (= people who like it very much) use to base their own stories, activities, etc. on:
examples: Things fans might produce in honour of a canon include paintings, comics, videos, fan fiction and cosplay.
Many Harry Potter fans don't consider anything but the published books to be canon.

body_content.explanation: a piece of music, or a way of singing or chanting in which one voice sings a part and then other voices sing the same part one at a time in a way that is slightly different:
examples: The phrases are chanted in canon by the monks as a form of meditation.
The music teacher taught the class to sing in a canon.
